title: How to Customize the Quick Access Toolbar in Microsoft Word (Windows 7)

steps.title: Locate the "Quick Access Toolbar".
steps.content: Locate the "Quick Access Toolbar". Click the down arrow at the right end of the toolbar. The "Customize Quick Access Toolbar" menu will open.

steps.title: From the drop down menu, click "More Commands".
steps.content: From the drop down menu, click "More Commands".

steps.title: From the new window, select commands such as:
steps.content: From the new window, select commands such as: "New", "Page Setup", "Quick Print", etc... Click "Add >>" to add them to the Quick Access Toolbar. Notice that the 3 commands has been added to the list of the "Customize Quick Access Toolbar"

steps.title: Click "OK" and click the check box "Show Quick Access Toolbar Below the Ribbon".
steps.content: Click "OK" and click the check box "Show Quick Access Toolbar Below the Ribbon". Now you can see the "Quick Access Toolbar" under the ribbon with 3 new buttons added.
